page.title: 05Oil Flows Through Himbleton
page.content: During 1985 the quiet villages in our area were invaded by one of the large oil companies when they undertook the major project of laying a pipeline from Wolverhampton to Fawley. First they fenced off a strip 60 metres wide , then they drove through removing all the top soil. This was followed by the digging of a trench. The pipes were laid out - three welds to each sectional joint , then lowered into the trench. The trench was then refilled and the top soil spread back over the surface. Finally each hedge that had to be grubbed out was then replaced and all the ditches redug. It is now difficult to see where the work was done.
